children.subject: I took CS 170 and EECS 126 last semester with another technical. It was quite a high workload; I spent about 20 - 30 hours per week doing homework. The hardest part was that neither classes are "easy" to grasp. They are very mathematical and require a lot of time before you can understand what happened during lecture (especially EECS 126 which is supposed to be an advanced upper-div). Of course, how long you would spend on the courses depends on your mathematical maturity (for reference, I was coming straight out of CS 70 without any other math or math-intensive CS courses). If you are ready to spend time grinding through the math and taking your time to appreciate the course material, I would really advise taking them, because they are great courses to build your foundations despite being high-workload.

history.content: I did it + one L&s breadth and got an A in all. I was pretty strong at 170 and spent little time studying for it compared to 126. Courseload is intense, have to spend all your time on psets every week (sometimes 20 hrs together)

Hey all,

Wondering how the courseload of those two together would be, alongside two other L&S breadths I don't anticipate taking too much time. I would appreciate any feedback on how your semester was. Thank you!
history.subject: Has anyone taken CS170 & EE126 in the same semester before?
